result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Boudreau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 145 days credit if revoked from probation.

miscConds.notes:
No violent or abusive contact w/victim.
Absolute sobriety, do not enter any establishments that sell or serve alcohol. 
No possession of alcohol.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY WOOD COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A Boudreau

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Defendant Richard A Boudreau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Richard A Boudreau.  Prosecuting attorney Rose Marie Yanke in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant requests to do a plea today. Attorney Yanke gives the court her sentencing recommendation. Attorney Kryshak agrees with it. Attorney Yanke gives the court a victim impact statement.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Boudreau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Richard A Boudreau. Victim appears in court by telephone.
Court asks the victim about the no contact condition. Attorney Lambert gives an argument against a bond modification. Attorney Kryshak gives the court an argument to modify the bond conditions to at least allow them telephone contact. Court denies the bond modification, but informs the defendant his Attorney is able to speak with her.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Boudreau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Richard A Boudreau. Victim appears in court by telephone.
Not guilty pleas are entered.
Bail/bond hearing on August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 9, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Court appoints Gary Kryshak as counsel - Defendant must pay $75.00 per month toward attorney fees
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Boudreau appeared by video, in custody. 
This matter is going to be adjourned so the defendant can get an attorney. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from victim requesting a modification of the no contact bond condition
Bail/bond hearing on July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:54 PM Defendant Richard A Boudreau in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Klug is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer with the Marshfield Police Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a residence for a disturbance. Testifies to making contact w/ the defendant on scene. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to observing signs of intoxication of the defendant and the defendant stating he was drunk. Testifies to speaking with PJB. Testifies to the statement PJB gave regarding what happened between the two. Testifies to not giving the defendant permission to hit her. 

Attorney McGrath requests the court take Judicial Notice of previous convictions, court grants.
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.

Bond is continued.
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. No contact with victim or their residence. $1500.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Boudreau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Federico in court for Richard A Boudreau.   Defendant is not eligible for PD representation.
